title: ICE: `unexpected generic param: GenericParam`: `closure_lifetime_binder` + `non_lifetime_binders`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: S-has-mcve
labels.description: A Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example has been found for this issue

body:
### Code ```Rust #![feature(closure_lifetime_binder)] #![feature(non_lifetime_binders)] #![crate_type = "lib"] fn T() { for || -> () {}; } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.69.0-nightly (f4f5fc3e5 2023-02-17) binary: rustc commit-hash: f4f5fc3e5cc70b7a43bf7b518c455f3d9bada9e3 commit-date: 2023-02-17 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.69.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.7 ``` ### Error output ``` warning: the feature `non_lifetime_binders` is incomplete and may not be safe to use and/or cause compiler crashes --> a371a027afa2856063889cf433200478158d8c47.rs:2:12 | 2 | #![feature(non_lifetime_binders)] | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: see issue #1 for more information = note: `#[warn(incomplete_features)]` on by default warning: function `T` is never used --> a371a027afa2856063889cf433200478158d8c47.rs:5:4 | 5 | fn T() { | ^ | = note: `#[warn(dead_code)]` on by default warning: function `T` should have a snake case name --> a371a027afa2856063889cf433200478158d8c47.rs:5:4 | 5 | fn T() { | ^ help: convert the identifier to snake case: `t` | = note: `#[warn(non_snake_case)]` on by default warning: unused closure that must be used --> a371a027afa2856063889cf433200478158d8c47.rs:6:5 | 6 | for || -> () {}; | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: closures are lazy and do nothing unless called = note: `#[warn(unused_must_use)]` on by default ```
Backtrace

``` error: internal compiler error: no errors encountered even though `delay_span_bug` issued error: internal compiler error: unexpected generic param: GenericParam { hir_id: HirId(DefId(0:3 ~ a371a027afa2856063889cf433200478158d8c47[2a77]::T).4), def_id: DefId(0:5 ~ a371a027afa2856063889cf433200478158d8c47[2a77]::T::{closure#0}::T), name: Plain(T#0), span: a371a027afa2856063889cf433200478158d8c47.rs:6:9: 6:10 (#0), pure_wrt_drop: false, kind: Type { default: None, synthetic: false }, colon_span: None } --> a371a027afa2856063889cf433200478158d8c47.rs:6:9 | 6 | for || -> () {}; | ^ | = note: delayed at 0: ::emit_diagnostic 1: ::delay_span_bug:: 2: ::visit_expr 3: ::visit_expr 4: ::resolve_type_vars_in_body 5: ::enter::::{closure#0}::{closure#1}, &rustc_middle::ty::typeck_results::TypeckResults> 6: rustc_hir_typeck::typeck 7: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query:: 8: rustc_data_structures::sync::par_for_each_in::<&[rustc_span::def_id::LocalDefId], ::par_body_owners::{closure#0}> 9: rustc_hir_typeck::typeck_item_bodies 10: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query:: 11: ::typeck_item_bodies 12: ::time::<(), rustc_hir_analysis::check_crate::{closure#7}> 13: rustc_hir_analysis::check_crate 14: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 15: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query:: 16: ::analysis 17: >::enter::, rustc_driver_impl::run_compiler::{closure#1}::{closure#2}::{closure#3}> 18: ::enter::, rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>> 19: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::run_compiler, rustc_driver_impl::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}> 20: >::set::, rustc_driver_impl::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>> 21: std::sys_common::backtrace::__rust_begin_short_backtrace::, rustc_driver_impl::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>> 22: <::spawn_unchecked_, rustc_driver_impl::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorGuaranteed>>::{closure#1} as core::ops::function::FnOnce<()>>::call_once::{shim:vtable#0} 23: as core::ops::function::FnOnce>::call_once at /rustc/f4f5fc3e5cc70b7a43bf7b518c455f3d9bada9e3/library/alloc/src/boxed.rs:1988:9 24: as core::ops::function::FnOnce>::call_once at /rustc/f4f5fc3e5cc70b7a43bf7b518c455f3d9bada9e3/library/alloc/src/boxed.rs:1988:9 25: std::sys::unix::thread::Thread::new::thread_start at /rustc/f4f5fc3e5cc70b7a43bf7b518c455f3d9bada9e3/library/std/src/sys/unix/thread.rs:108:17 26: 27: note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.69.0-nightly (f4f5fc3e5 2023-02-17) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu query stack during panic: end of query stack error: aborting due to 2 previous errors; 4 warnings emitted ```
